headline: Man Utd denied £44m January transfer audition as Premier League suspension confirmed
body: Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim will miss the opportunity to scout one of his midfield transfer targets in action next week when they face Wolves in the Premier League. The position is an area of priority for Jason Wilcox next month after investing over £200milllion elsewhere back in the summer.

United are expected to weigh up their options in January when the transfer window opens. The Reds bolstered their squad with a new goalkeeper, striker and two additional forwards in the previous window, but failed to secure a new central midfielder.

A potential deal for Carlos Baleba fell through after Brighton and Hove Albion's asking price was deemed too steep. Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton and Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson are also reportedly on United's radar following their standout performances this season.

However, another name has surfaced in recent months - Wolves' Brazilian sensation Joao Gomes. The 24-year-old was previously linked with a move to Old Trafford, prior to United's £50million acquisition of Manuel Ugarte in 2024.

According to The Telegraph, Wolves believe that Gomes' value is higher with the club in the Premier League, rather than as a Championship side if they suffer relegation. Other reports have suggested that the midfielder could command a fee close to £44m.

After their midweek loss to Nottingham Forest, the Wanderers are heading to Old Trafford on Monday in search of their first victory of the season. The match was seen as a chance for Amorim to watch Gomes play live before the transfer window, but that's now off the table.

Gomes received his fifth yellow card on Wednesday night, resulting in a one-match ban. This means Rob Edwards will have to delve into his squad for the journey to Old Trafford, with Marshall Munetsi tipped to step in.

Fellow Brazilian Andre is another Wolves player that both Amorim and United will be keeping tabs on. The midfielder has previously been linked with a move to United and is also rumoured to be on Arsenal and Liverpool's radar.
Whether United will be active in the January transfer window remains to be seen. However, potential exits could significantly impact their plans, with several players garnering attention.

Reports suggest that Kobbie Mainoo, Joshua Zirkzee, Ugarte and Tyrell Malacia could all be allowed to depart. None of the quartet have been regular starters this season, and ESPN have reported that the club is open to offers.

With Bryan Mbeumo, Amad and Noussair Mazraoui set to participate in the Africa Cup of Nations, United could find themselves short-handed for the second half of the season, leaving Amorim in a tricky spot.

headline: Sir Alex Ferguson's message to Liverpool board about Arne Slot's future after dire run
body: Manchester United icon Sir Alex Ferguson has long held the position that consistency is key when it comes to managerial success. As such, he would likely recommend Liverpool stick with Arne Slot despite a downpour in results at Anfield of late.

A disappointing 1-1 draw at home to Sunderland on Wednesday has left the Merseysiders with only four wins from their last 14 games. And after dazzling English audiences by winning the Premier League title in his debut campaign last term, Slot is now struggling to escape scrutiny.

United legend Ferguson was no stranger to the sensation during his 27 years in charge at Old Trafford. And although he retired in 2013 as arguably the greatest manager in British history, even Ferguson came in for serious questioning at points across that tenure.

The Scot left an all but impossible lead to follow when David Moyes was appointed his immediate United successor. And after his countryman was fired only 11 months into the role, Ferguson called for clubs to show patience with their picks even when pressure is being ramped up.

"There's no evidence that sacking a manager gives you success," said Ferguson in 2015. "But there is evidence at Manchester United, at Nottingham Forest, at Arsenal that [if] you retain the manager for long periods, you get consistency and you get success."

Former rival Arsene Wenger was in charge at Arsenal for almost 22 years and brought the Gunners into the 21st century. The Frenchman won three Premier League titles and seven FA Cups in England, but his greatest impact at Arsenal was arguably instilling a culture and style that only comes with time.

Ferguson also referred to Nottingham Forest and Brian Clough's 18-year spell in charge at the City Ground. And it was under Clough's command the club won back-to-back European Cups, attaining huge success in the late 1970s in particular.

Liverpool owners Fenway Sports Group (FSG) proved they made the right pick in appointing Slot as Jurgen Klopp's successor last season. But that instant gratification has been muddied by a torrid couple of months.

That being said, while Manchester United have displayed a habit for fast turnover when it comes to coaching appointments, Liverpool traditionally show a little more faith. Slot is Liverpool's seventh managerial appointment of the 21st century, while the Red Devils have had six since Ferguson departed the club only 12 years ago.

Not only that, but the fact Slot accomplished so much, and was in fact in the running for a quadruple, in his debut season should give him a stay of execution. It's also easy to forget Liverpool initially made a sensational start to the season by winning their first seven games of the campaign.
Bearing that in mind, it may not take many tweaks before the Liverpool of that not-too-distant past is back. And Ferguson's own history serves as proof a little bit of trust can go an awful long way.

headline: Ruben Amorim receives clear message on 'special' Man Utd transfer target as rivals circle
body: Manchester United have been encouraged to push through a deal for Nottingham Forest's Elliot Anderson after claims he would be a "special" addition to the squad. Ruben Amorim is believed to be searching for midfield reinforcements, particularly as Kobbie Mainoo has slipped down the pecking order under the Portuguese head coach.

Additionally, Casemiro is in the final 12 months of his Old Trafford deal and is yet to commit his future to the club. United have been strongly linked with a swoop for Forest star Anderson, who has been in impressive form this season.

Manchester City are also reportedly monitoring the 23-year-old midfielder, who under contract at the City Ground until June 2029. Forest are said to be reluctant to part with Anderson during the January window, even if bids approaching £100million arrive.

However, reports suggest potential suitors believe an offer exceeding £80m might be enough to persuade club owner Evangelos Marinakis to reconsider his stance. Former Premier League striker Dean Saunders has now urged United to make their move and pip City to Anderson's signature.
The ex-Wolves and Wrexham boss reckons he could prove instrumental in helping Amorim drive the club forward.

Speaking to BoyleSports, he said: "Elliot Anderson understands the position. He understands when he should go forward and who he's playing with. He doesn't give the ball away, which is a common trait among the best players I ever played with.

"They've all got one thing in common - they don't give the ball away and he's one of them. He's getting better. Forest just needs to get a few more wins and get him up the league so he can play without the pressure being on him.

"Manchester United picked up another win at the weekend, which is keeping the wolves from the door. Matheus Cunha, Bryan Mbeumo and Benjamin Sesko, I think they're better than what they had. They've signed three good players there and adding Anderson to it would be special.
"Ruben Amorim has just got to keep surviving. He's just got to keep getting three points when he needs it and giving himself time to work this jigsaw puzzle out."

Multiple clubs are reportedly lining up to secure Anderson's signature, with the midfielder earning widespread acclaim for his commanding performances since arriving at Forest just over 12 months ago. Whilst a move back to former club Newcastle has been dismissed due to financial constraints, Liverpool are also believed to be monitoring his situation closely.

Anderson's impressive form has earned him a place in the England squad, with manager Thomas Tuchel singing his praises. The German tactician has hailed Anderson as an "important" player for the Three Lions, despite the midfielder having only accumulated six caps to date.

Speaking last month, Tuchel said: "Anderson is a key player for us at the moment. He is one of the best midfielders in the Premier League - that's why he is with us and starting for us. He deserves it because he has been nothing but impressive. He has to keep on going now though.

'He is a very complete and mobile midfielder, and that's what he keeps showing me. He is an elite player with the right attitude and a lot of talent. He is fulfilling his role in the best way possible so we are very happy with him."

headline: Man United vs West Ham Premier League prediction, odds and betting offer
body: Manchester United reignited their resurgence last weekend with a 2-1 comeback victory at Crystal Palace, while West Ham were left frustrated after Lucas Paqueta’s controversial red card contributed to a 2-0 defeat against Liverpool.

United’s win at Selhurst Park ended Crystal Palace’s longest-ever unbeaten home run in the Premier League, as Oliver Glasner’s side had gone 12 consecutive games without defeat on their own turf. Jean-Philippe Mateta’s retaken penalty put Palace ahead, but goals from Joshua Zirkzee and Mason Mount—both set up by Bruno Fernandes’ free kicks—turned the game in United’s favor.

The victory was a much-needed response for the Red Devils following their disappointing home loss to 10-man Everton. Now sitting seventh in the table, United are just three points behind third-placed Chelsea as gameweek 14 approaches.

Since a rocky start to the season, with four defeats in their first seven matches across all competitions, Ruben Amorim has overseen just one loss in United’s last seven outings. However, the Portuguese manager faces the prospect of an unwanted record: if United lose on Thursday, Amorim will have suffered 10 Premier League defeats at Old Trafford in just 20 matches—reaching that milestone faster than any other manager in the club’s history.

December has not been kind to Manchester United in recent years, as they are currently on a three-game Premier League losing streak in the month, failing to score in any of those matches. Still, the Old Trafford crowd may have more to cheer about than their visitors, whose three-match unbeaten run ended against a resurgent Liverpool side last weekend, thanks in part to Paqueta’s dismissal.

Between goals from Alexander Isak and Cody Gakpo, Paqueta received his marching orders after dissent, then made headlines with a fiery online attack on the FA, criticizing their lack of support during his spot-fixing investigation—a case in which he was ultimately cleared.

Depending on other results this week, Nuno Espirito Santo’s side, currently 17th, could find themselves in the relegation zone before Thursday’s kickoff. The West Ham manager will be seeking his first Premier League away win with the club at the fifth attempt. The last time a West Ham boss failed to win any of their first five top-flight away games was Avram Grant in 2010.

headline: 8 players who could miss Man Utd vs West Ham as Ruben Amorim confirms injury blow
body: Manchester United and West Ham could be without as many as eight players for their Premier League clash on Thursday night. Ruben Amorim's squad are back in action, aiming for consecutive victories after their triumphant comeback against Crystal Palace on Sunday.

The Reds overturned a deficit to defeat the Eagles at Selhurst Park, with Joshua Zirkzee and Mason Mount netting goals to secure all three points after Jean-Philippe Mateta had put the home side ahead.

West Ham, on the other hand, are looking to bounce back from a 2-0 defeat to Liverpool on Sunday. Prior to this, the Hammers had enjoyed a three-match unbeaten streak, winning against Newcastle United and Burnley before the international break and then drawing 2-2 with Bournemouth.
Despite West Ham's recent uptick in form, United will be anticipating a win if they hope to secure a spot in the Champions League by season's end.

However, United will have to face the Hammers without Benjamin Sesko and Harry Maguire, who have been ruled out by Amorim. Both Sesko and Maguire have missed the last two games due to injuries sustained in the 2-2 draw with Tottenham prior to the November international break.
Amorim also hinted that there may be two additional unnamed players who are doubtful for the match against West Ham.
The United head coach did, however, confirm that Matheus Cunha is available for selection after being sidelined for the previous two fixtures, alongside Sesko and Maguire.
Speaking ahead of the West Ham clash, Amorim revealed: "We have two doubts for the game, it will change the way we're going to approach it, let's see if they can play. The rest of the squad is good.
"Matheus is back. Harry and Sesko are still out."
As for West Ham, they are set to be without four players for their journey to Old Trafford.

Nuno Espirito Santo confirmed on Tuesday that Crysencio Summerville won't feature in the matchday squad, whilst Lucas Paqueta is serving a suspension following his incredible red card during the loss to Liverpool.
Young left-back Ollie Scarles has progressed to non-contact training but remains unavailable to face United.
Additionally, experienced goalkeeper Lukasz Fabianski continues to be ruled out with a back injury.

headline: Man Utd news: JJ Gabriel transfer stance emerges as Scott McTominay sends message
body: Manchester United are preparing to face West Ham United at Old Trafford, hoping to build on their 2-1 away win over Crystal Palace at the weekend.

Ruben Amorim’s side found themselves behind at the break in south London following Jean-Philippe Mateta’s penalty, but responded after the interval. Goals from Joshua Zirkzee and Mason Mount ensured that United bounced back from last week’s home defeat by Everton.

Manchester United are confident of keeping academy starlet JJ Gabriel following Barcelona’s interest in the teenager. The 15-year-old came to wider attention following a hat-trick for United’s U18 side at the weekend and has scored 10 in as many games so far this term.

Barcelona have previously invited Gabriel and his family to the Camp Nou, with the United prospect also meeting first team players and touring the club’s facilities. However, United are determined to fend off Barcelona’s long-standing interest in the England U16 international.

United boss Amorim, who has already involved Gabriel in training, has spoken about the youngster: “Like everyone, I know he is a really talented guy and everyone paid attention on social media. You could see the U21s had a game and we had less players and tried to pick players for training that have talent.

“Not just for me to see for tomorrow but for them to feel what it means to be in the first team, the difficulties playing against our defenders, the difficulty of our training, the pace. If we can use every training we have to show the kids what they need to do to be here, it is important, not just for JJ but for everyone."

Scott McTominay has made it clear that he has no regrets over his decision to leave Manchester United. The 28-year-old joined Napoli last summer and enjoyed a dream campaign as he helped the club win the Serie A title.
The Sun reported that upon being named Serie A Player of the Year at the Gran Gala del Calcio awards, McTominay said: "Coming to Napoli was an easy choice, I came to the right place.”
McTominay made 255 appearances for his boyhood club. However, leaving United has given the Scotland international a new lease of life.

He added: "It's sensational, it's incredible to be here and win this award. Thank you to everyone, the team, the staff, and my teammates. My bond with Napoli is special, there are so many special places here."

headline: Ruben Amorim told January transfer Man Utd must make to fix problem position
body: Former Manchester United star Wes Brown has urged head coach Ruben Amorim to add a left wing-back to his squad in January. Patrick Dorgu joined the club in the last winter window as wing-back cover on both flanks, but Amorim appears less settled on the left than in some other positions.

Dorgu, who joined from Lecce in Amorim's first window in charge, has struggled to replicate his international form at club level. United's boss has urged the Dane to play with less anxiety, and Brown thinks the answer for now could be to add a specialist in the position.

"I’m probably going to have to go with… and I’m not sure if Luke Shaw can do it… a left wing-back," Brown told the No Tippy Tappy Football podcast when asked about the transfer United need to prioritise. "But I reckon we’ll see Luke Shaw there in the upcoming games.
"You want to have that [energy] at wing-back. Amad Diallo can do it. He’s going to lose a few at the back-post, I suppose, every now and again, but you can see the difference in age.

"I just feel with Manchester United at the moment, a lot of our good possession and where we’re strong is on the right-hand side. Our left probably isn’t as strong and it would be nice to see that so United can both ways. Everybody knows Bryan Mbeumo and Amad, when they get on the ball, it’s dangerous. It’s not exactly the same on that left-hand side."

England international Shaw struggled with injuries last season but has put together a run of games under Amorim this term. Those outings have mostly come as one of three centre-backs, though, rather than in the physically demanding left-back role.

Tyrell Malacia is also a left-sided specialist, but the Dutchman appears to have no Old Trafford future despite failing to seal a summer move away. The former Feyenoord star has been an unused sub three times this season without making it onto the pitch, and is out of contract in June.

United take on West Ham on Thursday, and a win would further boost their hopes of European qualification. Amorim confirmed Benjamin Sesko and Harry Maguire will miss the game through injury, but Matheus Cunha is ready to return.

"We have two doubts for the game," Amorim added in his Wednesday press conference.. "I will not tell you today because we will change the way we are going to approach [the game]. Let's see if they can play tomorrow."

headline: Joshua Kimmich thinks Man Utd could be signing a player who wowed him - 'Was on my radar'
body: Manchester United are targeting a player who once left Joshua Kimmich wowed. United spent big in the summer on attacking reinforcements but are set to turn their attentions to defence and midfield in the next two windows.

Ruben Amorim's project at United is still a work in progress, with the side hopeful of showing signs that they are moving in the right direction under the head coach. The 40-year-old has been in charge for just over one year now, taking over from Erik ten Hag.

His arrival came with an understanding that it would take some time for his 3-4-3 system to work, but patience has worn thin among some of the fanbase at times. A Europa League final defeat to Tottenham and a lack of European football for this season has only ramped up the pressure on Amorim so far.

With that in mind, and the focus on some improvements in the near future, United are looking towards the transfer market for the next possible signings who could help. There will be a keen sense of trying to find value, as well as those who can make something of an immediate impact.

According to BILD, one of the players on the club's radar is Nathaniel Brown, a left-back from Eintracht Frankfurt. The 22-year-old could be viewed as a possible recruit for the left wing-back role that is in place in Amorim's system, which hasn't quite been nailed down by any player yet.

Brown, 22, has been a regular for Frankfurt since he signed for the club last season, having had a knack for scoring and assisting a goal or two. There is an expectation that Brown will leave Eintracht Frankfurt in the near future, with the club said to be welcoming offers and ready to cash in.
However, a fee in the region of £57m could be demanded, while a move in the summer seems more likely than the January transfer window, given the player's World Cup hopes.

Arsenal and Real Madrid are also believed to be in the mix for the defender, who have all been monitoring him in recent months. The German international has received plenty of praise in recent weeks for his performances, including some kind words from Joshua Kimmich.

Despite being on the end of a 3-0 defeat to Bayern Munich, Brown defended well when coming up against Michael Olise, which led to some praise. Kimmich said after the game: "He did well, especially because he played against Michael [Olise].

"I know from my own experience how difficult that is, but I already had him [Brown] on my radar beforehand." Brown will now have one eye on making the Germany squad for the 2026 World Cup, with an opportunity up for grabs.

It's a position for United that could do with some more consistency, with Amorim needing specific traits from his wing-backs in the system. The head coach has often switched between using Patrick Dorgu and Diogo Dalot on the left, with some uncertainty over the position.
Amorim was particularly frank about the struggles Dorgu has faced so far, as he recently said: "When I see them training they are doing so much better than in games.

"Then Patrick, when I see him playing for the national team, he’s scored a great goal against Scotland, the decision that he made under pressure was completely different to the decision[s] he’s making in our team. You can feel the anxiety every time Patrick touches the ball. I can feel it, the anxiety.”

The potential interest in a player like Brown could indicate just how unsure Amorim is of his current wing-back options at his disposal, particularly on the left. It's unclear whether the defender would be open to such a move, but it indicates the type of market that United are operating in.
The club are keen on finding value, adding in the young stars who can add quality with room to grow for the future and perform beyond their transfer fee.

headline: Ex-Man Utd star Remi Moses is alive as son speaks out after 'funeral announcement'
body: Former Manchester United midfielder Remi Moses is alive and well – despite rumours that he had sadly passed away. Moses spent eight years of his career with United after making his professional debut with West Bromwich Albion.

He was United's first-ever black goalscorer and was also included in Sir Alex Ferguson's first-ever team for the defeat at Oxford United in November 1986. However, it was claimed on Wednesday that he had passed away.
Moses and his wife are claimed to be living in Zakynthos, a Greek island in the Ionian Sea. The 65-year-old former midfielder also coached at Doxa Pigadakion for a short spell a couple of years ago.
And in a statement on Wednesday, the Greek outfit claimed it was his wife who informed them of Moses' death. But journalist Andy Mitten has revealed that Moses is alive and well.

Taking to social media platform X, he wrote: "Understand social media rumours of Remi Moses dying are not true. He's alive and well. But had he looked on social media, he'd have seen how many people absolutely loved him as a player."

Replying to Mitten's post, Reece Blakeley, one of Moses' children, confirmed: "I have just spoken with my brothers (his sons). Can confirm the legend is still alive and well." While a United spokesperson said: "Remi's family have confirmed to us that the rumours of his passing are entirely false. They are baffled about their origins, and report him to be healthy and in good spirits."

Moses made 199 appearances for United, and earlier today, a statement from Doxa Pigadakion even went as far as revealing when his funeral would take place. The statement read: "Our club had the honour, for a short time, to collaborate in sports with Manchester United footballer, Remi Moses, when in the 2020/2021 season, he was the coach of our women's team.

"To the fanatical football fans, and not only to the fans of the Bebedos of English football, he will always remain in our minds, as that football player in the mid-80s, who wrote endless kilometers in the midfield of Manchester United.
"His great football moment was the qualification in 1984, against Barcelona, when he personally limited Maradona to these two matches.
"Remi, for several years now, has been a permanent resident of Zakynthos. With our club, and with its people, he has always had communication and a two-way sporting respect.
"These feelings led his wife to contact us immediately yesterday Tuesday morning, to inform us that Remi is no longer with us, and to ask for some small help.
"Our club expresses its deepest condolences to his family. The funeral service will take place on Saturday, December 13th at 12:00 noon, in the parish of Argassi."

headline: Man Utd handed Matheus Cunha boost but have two injury doubts for West Ham
body: Manchester United star Matheus Cunha is back in contention ahead of Thursday’s clash with West Ham but two mystery stars are doubts. The Brazilian has missed the Red Devils’ last two matches against Everton and Crystal Palace with a slight issue.
But United can welcome the former Wolves star back into contention this week. Cunha has been spotted back in training and is available to play.
Despite that positive news, boss Ruben Amorim could have a few headaches, with a couple of United stars potentially doubtful - albeit the Portuguese coach stopped short of revealing who.

"We have two doubts for the game, it will change the way we’re going to approach it, let’s see if they can play," the United head coach said in his pre-match press conference. "The rest of the squad is good. Matheus is back. Harry and Sesko are still out."

Regardless, Cunha’s return will be a huge boost, with United having a few issues when it comes to their attack. The 26-year-old has scored just once since his £62.5m move from Wolves but Amorim believes there is far better to come.

He added: “He has more levels to go. He’s at a different club, different pressure. He was struggling because he was not scoring, he was thinking too much about the numbers but the influence he has in the team is important to us.”

Cunha’s return will give the United boss a decision to make over his side. Dutch forward Joshua Zirkzee has been leading the line over the past few weeks and scored his first goal of the season in the comeback victory against Crystal Palace last time out.
Another star who Amorim has a decision to make over is central defender Leny Yoro. The Frenchman has endured a difficult few weeks but Amorim has backed the defender to overcome his issues.

He said: “It’s really important. I also spoke with him because he thinks too much, he makes a mistake and then he struggles. He wants to do everything so well. He’s growing, with games and with setbacks, it’s not easy for him as a young guy.
“He cannot show that to the people the way he came to the bench, he knows that. It shows he cares, he knows it wasn’t his best game.”
Following their clash with West Ham, United will then turn their attention to a showdown with rock-bottom Wolves on Monday evening at Molineux.

headline: FIFA confirm AFCON decision that impacts Man Utd and Liverpool
body: FIFA have confirmed the deadline for clubs to release players for this month's Africa Cup of Nations will be December 15. Teams were previously required to send players to their national sides by December 8.

Discussions between key stakeholders have resulted in the pushback, meaning Premier League teams will have the luxury of having their African players for an extra week. FIFA made a similar decision ahead of the 2022 World Cup.

It means that Liverpool will now have Mohamed Salah for their league game against Brighton & Hove Albion. It also means that Manchester United trio Bryan Mbeumo, Amad Diallo and Noussair Mazraoui won't be released until later this month.

FIFA have said that the delay in the deadline for clubs to release players followed "fruitful consultations led by FIFA with key stakeholders and, thanks to the spirit of solidarity demonstrated by CAF to reduce the impact on various parties."

The decision allows clubs playing in the Champions League to retain any players set to play in AFCON for fixtures next week. Players also competing in the Europa and Conference Leagues will also be available.

Sunderland are facing the prospect of losing seven players to the competition and had looked set to play the first top-flight Tyne-Wear derby without them players. However, they will now have a full selection.
Wolves are set to have five players participate, with Nottingham Forest losing four. Arsenal, Chelsea and Leeds United are the only Premier League clubs expected not to be impacted.
The tournament begins on December 21 when hosts Morocco take on Comoros. It runs throughout the end of December and into the new year, with the final taking place on January 18.

headline: Barcelona try to sign another Man Utd talent amid Marcus Rashford call and Ruben Amorim meeting
body: Barcelona are stepping up efforts to sign Manchester United teenager JJ Gabriel. The 15-year-old sensation is among the most talked-about talent in the Red Devils' academy - having scored 10 goals in 10 matches for the Under-18s this term.

However, according to The Sun, Barcelona are trying to prise Gabriel away from United and take him to their famous La Masia youth system. It's added that United director of football Jason Wilcox was key in convincing Gabriel to remain at he club this season and next campaign.

Sources from the Red Devils feel the involvement of Wilcox showed Gabriel's family how much they value the attacking midfielder, and believe he could have a huge future at Old Trafford. There is confidence that the 2010-born starlet will stay at United for the long haul, rebuffing interest from Barcelona.

Last week, United's head coach Ruben Amorim was said to have held a separate meeting with Gabriel and his camp. It came after the teenage sensation was pictured in first-team training with the rest of the United squad.

Gabriel was promoted to train with the senior players last Thursday as the Under-21s had a behind-closed-doors game on Friday and went up against Anderlecht in the Premier League International Cup on Tuesday night.

In an Instagram post back in October, Gabriel confirmed that he had trained with the first-team and Amorim was asked about his inclusion. "Like everyone, I know he is a really talented guy, and everyone paid attention on social media," the Portuguese said at the time.

"You could see the U21s had a game and we had less players and tried to pick players for training that have talent. Not just for me to see for tomorrow, but also for them to feel what it means to be in the first-team, the difficulties playing against our defenders, the difficulty of our training, the pace.
"If we can use every training we have to show the kids what they need to do to be here, it's important, not just for JJ, but for everyone."

Gabriel is the latest United star Barcelona are trying to snap-up, with the Catalan giants hoping to bring Marcus Rashford back on a permanent deal next summer. The 28-year-old forward has enjoyed a stellar start to his loan spell at Barca, scoring six times and adding nine assists in 19 appearances.

He was named on the subs bench for Tuesday's 3-1 win against Atletico Madrid but made a vital contribution as a second-half substitute to help his side to a crucial three points. Speaking post-match, Rashford sent a message to the Barca fans. "Important win and great team performance," Rashford posted on Instagram.

Barcelona have the option to make his transfer permanent at the end of the season for a fee of £26million. There was a chance for Rashford to join Aston Villa this summer - after an impressive loan stint in the second half of the 2024/25 season - but Villa chose not to exercise their £40m option.

Rashford will have the chance to add to his goals and assist tally for Barcelona when they take on Real Betis in La Liga this weekend. It will be the first time Rashford goes up against his former United teammate Antony since both players opted to leave the Red Devils on loan in January.

body: Marcus Rashford gave Barcelona a much-needed lift from the bench in their 3-1 triumph over Atletico Madrid on Tuesday. The victory at Camp Nou extended the La Liga leaders' advantage over Real Madrid to four points.

His introduction, along with Ferran Torres, added some spark to Hansi Flick's attack, and it was the Spanish substitute who scored the third and final goal of the match in the 96th minute.

Despite this being the fourth consecutive match in all competitions where the England star hasn't scored or assisted, his contribution on Tuesday was positively received, as noted by sections of the Spanish media.

He came close to scoring and provided a much-needed boost for Barca in the final minutes."
Mundo Deportivo echoed these sentiments, praising his counter-attacking abilities thanks to his impressive speed, which nearly saw him add to his tally of two league goals this season.
The publication stated: "He breaks free on the counter-attack after a pass from Casado and shoots after a cutback, but Oblak deflects it with his foot. Great play by the Englishman."

headline: Man Utd bring back what Sir Jim Ratcliffe cancelled after Omar Berrada's intervention
body: Manchester United's 2025 Christmas party has reportedly been given the go-ahead after Sir Jim Ratcliffe cancelled last year's. The United hierarchy stopped any festive cheer 12 months ago following a round of cuts.

Last year, the party was cancelled after it was deemed inappropriate to celebrate following a first round of redundancies that resulted in 250 jobs being axed. The scrapped celebration saved the club more than £100,000, with the annual staff bonus of £100 being replaced with a £40 voucher from M&S.

Now, the Daily Mail have reported that staff members will get the opportunity to celebrate Christmas this year, with chief executive Omar Berrada deciding to invite all staff members to the event. It will be held in one of the larger suites at Old Trafford, with food and musical entertainment provided for employees.
The decision comes after United's hierarchy ran the changes following Ineos' minority takeover. A further 200 redundancies, which reduced the workforce from 1,150 to 700, saved the club millions.

"If we hadn't have implemented the cost programmes and restructuring that we have done over the last 12 months. So we have to deal with all those things, and there's only so many things you can deal with at once.
"We have a new management team, we have to deal with the financial restructure, then we have to move on to the squad, data analysis, and moving forward.

"But we are in the process of change and it's an uncomfortable period and disruptive and I do feel sympathy with the fans. But I am not actually surprised where we are in the league because Ruben's only got a certain size of squad he can deal with, and quite a number of those players are injured or not available to him."
He added: "The simple answer is the club runs out of money at Christmas if we don't do those things [widespread cuts and restructuring].
"Ultimately, if you look at running the club the size of Manchester United with an income of about £650m you spend a part of that £650m on operating the club and part of it on the squad.
"Where do you want to spend the money? Do you want to spend it on operating the club, or do you want to spend it on the squad? Because if you spend it on the squad you get better results.

"And at the end of the day what's Manchester United here for if it's not to win trophies and silverware. What we want to do is invest in the best players in the world if we can, rather than spend it on, I'm afraid, free lunches."

headline: Man Utd transfer plans emerge with three January deals plotted and destination in mind
body: Three Manchester United players are all-set to depart the club on loan next month. Chido Obi, Ayden Heaven and Diego Leon are the trio in question, with United head coach Ruben Amorim ready to allow them to gain more first-team experience during the second half of the season.

First, Obi hasn't played a single minute of senior action for United during the 2025/26 season after Amorim decided to leave him in the Under-21s for this campaign. He has since shone, netting five times in 13 matches.
The 18-year-old, who made eight first-team appearances for the Red Devils last term, is continually improving and there are whispers the next step is to loan him out in the January transfer window.
Indeed, The Sun reports that United are open to loaning Obi out next month to help further his development by gaining more first-team minutes in the EFL or National League.

Heaven, 19, is another player United are aiming to loan out. The youngster made a name for himself when he was thrust into the limelight by Amorim last season, particularly impressing against his former club Arsenal.

However, like Obi, Heaven has found regular first-team game-time hard to come by this term. He has clocked up just 28 minutes in the Premier League, coming on as a second-half substitute against Fulham and Brighton.
And with Lisandro Martinez's return from injury, Heaven has been demoted to being third-choice left centre back, behind the Argentine World Cup winner and England international Luke Shaw.

Heaven's spot on the bench could also be in jeopardy when Harry Maguire returns to fitness in the coming weeks. Heaven recently had a stint with the U21s against Solihull Moors in the National League Cup.
Leon, another United youngster, is being tipped for a loan move. The prodigy, born in 2007, joined the Reds from Cerro Porteno over the summer, but has yet to make his first-team debut.

Despite being included in their senior matchday squad four times, Leon's playing time has been with the U21s this season. He netted his first goal for Travis Binnion's side in a 4-1 victory over Tottenham in October.

Goalkeeper Radek Vitek has thrived since his loan move to Championship team Bristol City in the summer, while full-back Harry Amass has impressed with Sheffield Wednesday. Both Vitek and Amass appear ready to step up to United's first-team squad next summer.
While the Reds could recall Amass due to their issues at left wing back, the club believes it's best for him to continue his development on loan at Wednesday.

headline: Ex-Man Utd hero sells treasured medals and memorabilia for eye-watering sum
body: Former Manchester United star Paul Parker has earned over £100,000 by selling a number of treasured pieces of memorabilia from his career. Parker, 61, played for the Red Devils between 1991 and 1996, making 146 appearances.

In that time, he won the Premier League, FA Cup and League Cup having played under legendary former boss Sir Alex Ferguson. But Parker has been willing to part with a number of items from across his playing career.

As per The Sun, the former defender decided to auction off a miniature silver Premier League trophy which was given to winners during the 1992/93 season instead of medals. The trophy reportedly fetched £27,280 when up for auction.
Other highlights included Parker’s medals from United’s 1993/94 Premier League triumph, as well as their FA Cup win vs Chelsea the same year. Each of the medals went for £16,120.

Parker’s League Cup winners medal fetched £5,700, while a further Charity Shield plaque was sold for £1,736. Away from items from his club career, Parker also decided to bid farewell to a host of mementos from his international career.

The former right-back sold off each of the 19 England caps that he had earned. Each of those fetched £3,720, except for the cap that Parker won when he played for the Three Lions’ in their defeat to West Germany in the semi-finals of the 1990 World Cup in Italy - that cap instead earning £8,060.
A spokesman for auctioneers Budds said: “The main reason for selling is that he is quite friendly with Viv Anderson and some of the other players who have sold their collections.
“With the market so strong for Manchester United mementos at the moment he wants to maximise their value and give the proceeds to his family.”

Speaking about his career with Man United earlier this year, Parker said: “Everything I wanted as a kid was to play for the biggest club I could. I always said, aim as high as you can. If you fail, you can always go down, but start at the top if you can.

“ The FA Cup final was the dream. That was what I wanted when I was a kid, playing in the garden. Back then, the FA Cup was the glamour game. It was the last match of the season, the one everyone talked about.

“It was only when I got into professional football that I realised the real prize is the league, the marathon. That’s what you’re judged on. You don’t have to be a great team to win the FA Cup, but you have to be a great team to win a league title.

“The sides I played in under Sir Alex, and the ones after me, were great champions because of the football they played: expansive, fearless, always attacking. We were never told to sit back. We played positively!”

body: Marcus Rashford has delivered a fresh message after the Manchester United loanee once again helped Barcelona claim a vital win in La Liga. Tuesday night saw Rashford and his team-mates earn a 3-1 victory over Atletico Madrid at the Camp Nou to move further clear at the top of the Spanish top-flight standings.

Despite being named on the bench, Rashford was brought into the contest by Barcelona boss Hansi Flick in the 67th minute, replacing Robert Lewandowski with the scoreline at 2-1. Former Manchester City star Ferran Torres then netted a third for Barca to seal the victory.
Even though Rashford didn't make the starting XI, the 68-cap England international was thrilled to contribute to Barcelona's victory, securing three more points in their La Liga campaign.
"Important win and great team performance," Rashford posted on Instagram.

This latest appearance marks Rashford's 19th game this season across all competitions, including 14 in La Liga. His contribution has helped the Catalan giants extend their lead at the top of the table to four points, ahead of their fiercest rivals Real Madrid.
Rashford's post comes just before the January transfer window opens, while speculation about the future of the United loanee is set to intensify as the New Year approaches.

headline: 'Sir Alex Ferguson said he wouldn't sign me for Man Utd - so I won the title with Liverpool'
body: Sir Alex Ferguson once brutally called out Jordan Henderson in public over his running style. The legendary Manchester United manager had been keeping tabs on the promising talent during his time at Sunderland and thought about making a move for him.
But after sending scouts to watch Henderson in action, Ferguson decided against pursuing the midfielder due to his unusual gait, claiming Henderson "runs from his knees".

Ferguson wrote in his autobiography: "We looked at Jordan Henderson a lot and Steve Bruce was unfailingly enthusiastic about him. Against that we noticed that Henderson runs from his knees, with a straight back, while the modern footballer runs from his hips."
He added: "We thought his gait might cause him problems later in his career."

United's oversight proved to be Liverpool's gain as, in 2011, a 20-year-old Henderson moved to Anfield for approximately £20million. He featured in 37 Premier League matches during his debut campaign under Sir Kenny Dalglish and nearly clinched the title in 2013/14 under Brendan Rodgers.
Henderson, currently at Brentford, later reacted to Ferguson's remarks by saying: "What was written in the book never bothered me.
"To be honest, I looked upon it as a compliment that I got a mention. The fact Alex Ferguson was watching me at some stage must have meant I was doing something right.

"I was never aware of any interest from United and I'm happy with how things worked out. I'm enjoying my football and we're progressing well as a team. I never felt as if I had a point to prove really except maybe to myself and to Liverpool Football Club in terms of improving as a player."
But Rodgers was left furious with the Scotsman's comments. He said: "I think if Sir Alex ever bumps into Jordan he might want to apologise for that.
"The comment surprised me, I have to be honest, coming from someone with such status in the game. Maybe it was meant as flippant but to a young player making his way in the game it could be damaging.
"Every player is different, and every player at this club has had his strengths and weaknesses medically assessed. The statement in terms of Jordan was inappropriate."
Henderson responded in the best possible way - with his performances on the pitch. He was named captain of Liverpool in the summer of 2015, ahead of Jurgen Klopp’s arrival a few months later.
He became instrumental in Klopp's Merseyside revolution as the team grew increasingly competitive, reaching the Champions League final in 2017/18 and claiming the trophy twelve months later.
Henderson also played 30 league matches during 2019/20 as Liverpool cruised to their first Premier League title, which they lifted when the season resumed during the Covid-19 pandemic.

The England midfielder clocked up a total of 492 appearances for the Reds, scoring 33 goals and providing 58 assists, figures that barely scratch the surface of his monumental influence both on and off the pitch.

In a shock move, he decided to leave Liverpool in 2023 for Steven Gerrard's Al-Ettifaq project in Saudi Arabia, believing his opportunities at Anfield under Klopp would be limited ahead of the new season.

Henderson's two former clubs, Liverpool and Sunderland, are set to face off in the Premier League on Wednesday night at Anfield. His boyhood team Sunderland have kicked off the season exceptionally and currently sit sixth in the table in their first season back in the top flight.
Meanwhile, reigning champions Liverpool are trailing by one point after a dismal run of form, which finally came to an end with a 2-0 victory over West Ham at the weekend.

headline: MARSHALL: Selection, videos and data boffins - How transformed Man United are rivalling set-piece kings Arsenal
body: A year ago today, Manchester United lost to Arsenal, conceding two goals from corner kicks. Later in the month, they would concede set-piece goals to Nottingham Forest and Bournemouth at Old Trafford, as well as seeing Tottenham and Wolves score direct from corners against them.

The heat was on Ruben Amorim's assistant Carlos Fernandes back then. United were a soft touch at set pieces and offered virtually no threat at the other end of the pitch, and that woeful combination led to calls for Fernandes to be stripped of set-piece planning responsibilities.

Now, every time United get a corner or a free-kick, Fernandes still rises to his feet to oversee the plans, but gone are the jitters that come defensively and the expectation that nothing will come of it in the opposition's penalty area. United's comeback success at Selhurst Park last weekend was thanks to two set-piece goals and only Arsenal have scored more of them this season.

But United are creating a higher xG from set-pieces and are scoring goals from them at a better rate than the Gunners, who only top the scoring charts because they have more attacking corners and free-kicks than Amorim's side. Amorim has admitted to stealing set-piece ideas from other clubs, but gave credit for the upturn in fortunes to the work Fernandes is doing on the training ground and the research he is putting in on the opposition.

He is backed up by 27-year-old first-team analyst Kaita Hasegawa, who is devoted to set-pieces. Hasegawa has also recruited a team of data experts tasked with focusing on them. Once Hasegawa and his team have passed the information on to Fernandes, the 31-year-old devises routines and gets down to business at Carrington on running the players through them. The work is paying dividends.
"In this league, set pieces can win you games," said Amorim. "Or you can lose if you don't pay attention to that. I'm really pleased with the job that they are doing."

United's approach to set-pieces seemed shambolic when Amorim first arrived, but, as with so much of the Portuguese head coach's first year, a lack of time on the training ground played a part in that.

Now, United have a week to prepare for most games, having failed to qualify for Europe and been dumped out of the Carabao Cup by League Two Grimsby in August. That free time is helping to improve their sharpness at set-pieces.
"Last year we trained without the real movement we can put in the position," said Amorim. "If you don't have space and you cannot put load because they are recovering, it's not the same thing.
"[Now] you have more time to kick corners and free-kicks and you can create real game situations this year. That helps. If you train more time you will improve. That is normal."
Amorim believes United can still improve defensively when it comes to set-pieces and admitted that area of the game is now so crucial in the Premier League that it is impacting his team selection.

"You have to think about who you put in the squad, if you play with Amad, Bryan, Bruno, all these guys," he said. "If you don't have Casemiro - and we suffer against Tottenham with that - not Sesko, not Harry.
"So you have to make a balance sometimes, thinking 'yes, the idea for the game is this one, but if you have set pieces against it cannot be this team'. Our league is like that at the moment.

"You need to think not just the way you are going to play but also in set pieces. If you look at it with a little bit of attention to the league you understand that set pieces are massive for the game. Sometimes, to open the game. If you score a goal you are in better conditions to win the game."

headline: MARSHALL: Amorim sends clear message to two Manchester United stalwarts - 'They have to fight'
body: Ruben Amorim has told Luke Shaw and Lisandro Martinez that they must fight it out for the right to get in his team as the Argentine's return from injury sets up a fascinating duel between the pair. Shaw has started every Premier League game this season and made his 300th appearance for Manchester United in Sunday's win against Crystal Palace.

But he was withdrawn towards the end at Selhurst Park and replaced by Martinez. The 27-year-old was making his first appearance in 10 months after recovering from a serious knee injury. Martinez has had misfortune with injuries in the last couple of years, but now that he is fit, he is desperate to make up for lost time and will be eyeing a challenge to Shaw to get in the team as Amorim's left-sided central defender.

There is a chance Shaw could yet be used as a left wing-back, although he has barely played that position since Amorim's arrival and the demands would be a test of his newfound durability. For now, the 30-year-old is likely to keep his place against West Ham on Thursday, but Amorim has set up a battle between the two left-footers for a place in his team going forward.

"They have to fight," he said. "We talked about that as a group last year. We needed to win the Europa League. You have 11 players because you have no idea what is playing one game per week. You are going to be upset because you are not going to play. It’s 11 players that can play and then the rest you have to fight. That is the situation. That is not a problem. That is a blessing. That is my job to choose.

"Licha is a guy who has a big character. I feel that he stops for a year and now he wants things really, really fast and you have to manage that to explain with that injury, we need to go step by step, but he's getting ready, he's feeling really strong. He's one more guy to help the team to play better, so I'm really happy with Licha at the moment."

Shaw's renaissance has been remarkable after his own injury woes restricted him to just five starts last season. He had made only 27 appearances across the last two seasons before his run in the side this term.

"We took special consideration in the beginning," said Amorim. "When we are building the player, we have to be careful. Trying to control the load, not putting so many minutes. Even the position is completely different.

"You know that the demands of that different position he is going to struggle. He adapts really well to that position because sometimes he's playing with the ball like a fullback. But he's defending more deeply. He's really smart.

"For me, I said already I think he's a world-class player. Of course, he needs more continuity. Like he's showing this season. We are playing just one game per week. That helps a lot. If he needs three days to recover, and he's not needing it now, but if he needs it we can give him.
"We are not taking special measures for him in this moment but we had to do it in the beginning when he was starting to have more minutes."

Amorim left the door open to Shaw playing as a wing-back in his system, with the absence of Noussair Mazraoui and Amad during the Africa Cup of Nations set to lead to a shortage of options in that position from mid-December.

"It's different, you have to train there," said Amorim. "Before you think to put a different player in that position, you need to train there. Or he needs to do some minutes and then he needs to come off. Or return to a different position.
"But he's ready to if we need him. Maybe we are going to need him and in this system he can play there."

headline: MARSHALL: United have two fresh injury doubts for West Ham after cryptic Ruben Amorim answer
body: Matheus Cunha is set to return to the Manchester United squad against West Ham on Thursday but Ruben Amorim has two fresh doubts that could force him to draw up a new game plan. Cunha is back in contention after missing the last two games following a training ground incident on the eve of United's game with Everton, but Amorim refused to confirm who the players at risk of missing the game were.

"We have two doubts for the game, it will change the way we’re going to approach it, let’s see if they can play," the United head coach said. The rest of the squad is good. Mathues is ack. Harry and Sesko are still out."

Maguire has been out for three weeks with a thigh injury and Sesko hasn't played since the draw at Tottenham after picking up a knee injury not long after coming off the bench in North London. Cunha has just one goal in 11 games for United since his move from Wolves in the summer and Amorim believes the Brazilian has more room for improvement as he prepares to return to the team.
"I think he has more levels to go," he said. "He is in a different club, different pressure but I think he copes with that really well.

"He was struggling because he was not scoring and he was thinking too much about the numbers. But the influence that he has in the team is so important for us but I think Cunha has so much to grow defensively and offensively."

West Ham will be without Lucas Paqueta after his red card against Liverpool but Amorim is confident his countryman Nuno Espirito Santo will be successful after taking over at the London Stadium earlier this season.

"I had no doubts he will have success," he said. "He’s really experienced, he knows how to work with different squads, understands really well the league. We know it’s going to be tough, he’s really smart preparing the games. The preparation is about the opponent but I’m focused on what we need to do and what we need to improve."

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Said El Mala 'interest', Baleba 'agreement', Semenyo latest
body: There is less than a month to go until the start of the January transfer window and Manchester United could once again look to strengthen their squad. Both incomings and outgoings have been brought up in the conversation for the Reds, who spent more than £200million in the summer but might decide to add to their ranks next month.

Should United want to bring players through the door, sales may be needed. Kobbie Mainoo is one star who has been heavily linked with a move away from the club, with Napoli said to hold an interest in the midfielder.
Meanwhile, Joshua Zirkzee, despite scoring his first Premier League goal since December 2024 in the win at Crystal Palace on Saturday, is another with Roma among those interested in him.

Looking at players United have been linked with, a new midfielder is thought to be at the top of Ruben Amorim's priorities with Elliot Anderson, Carlos Baleba and Adam Wharton tipped to make the move to Old Trafford.
While work will be going on around the transfer window, Amorim will have eyes on midweek Premier League action. United host West Ham United tonight as they look to record back-to-back wins.
Stay here for all of the latest transfer news and rumours throughout the day...
Man United and Chelsea are reportedly tracking teenage midfielder Mohamed Zongo.
According to Caught Offside, Chelsea are well-placed in the race, despite United, Villarreal and Anderlecht having made the early running.
Zongo impressed at the recent Under-17 World Cup, scoring twice as Burkina Faso reached the quarter-finals.
Man United have been urged to seal a deal for Nottingham Forest midfielder Elliot Anderson after being told he would be a "special" signing.
Ruben Amorim is understood to be in the market for a midfielder as Kobbie Mainoo has fallen out of favour with the Portuguese boss.

United have been heavily linked with a move for the Nottingham Forest star following his impressive form this season. Manchester City are also reported to be interested in the 23-year-old midfielder, whose contract at the City Ground expires in June 2029.
Read more here.
El Mala is the latest player to be linked with a move to Man United.
Here's everything you need to know about the FC Koln winger.
Reports in Spain suggest Man United are admirers of FC Koln winger Said El Mala, with Liverpool and Chelsea also interested.
European football expert Andy Brassell, believes United are 'the most sensible option' for the winger.

"You don't really look at Manchester United and say there is a great place for a young player to develop," he said. "But if you're looking at where he would fit logically, United is the most sensible one out of those, I think.
"Liverpool are obviously in a state of flux at the moment, and you wonder how much football he would actually play there. [Man] City have wide players absolutely to die for at the moment.

"So you wonder how much he would play there. United is maybe the obvious one. You look at their successes of late, United, and really, you look at someone like Amad [Diallo], and he is someone who feels quite old school United.

"A player who is not scared of stepping up despite the pressure, despite the situation, despite this sort of heaviness that seems to be around United all the time. He still wants to get on the ball and make stuff happen. You could definitely imagine El Mala doing that as well, from the other side."
Reports in Spain suggest Man United are ready to bid over €150m (£131m) this summer to lure either Vinicius Juior or Fede Valverde from Real Madrid.
Valverde is viewed by the Reds as an 'absolute priority' in their rebuild, while Vinícius has yet to sign a new contract at the Santiago Bernabeu - a situation United are monitoring closely.
Football Insider claim that Man United have chosen to 'accelerate' their pursuit for Antoine Semenyo.
Losing Bryan Mbeumo and Amad later this month has triggered concern for the club. Former Man Utd chief scout Mick Brown said: "Losing players to AFCON is a major concern for Amorim.

“Both Mbeumo and Amad are going, and Mazraoui behind them, so its the entire right-hand side going away for at least a month. It could have a real big impact on their season if they’re not prepared, and the manager feels the squad is light in those areas, so something will have to be done.

"Semenyo is the one they’ve been looking at, because Ghana didn’t qualify for AFCON. It looks like he will be available in January because of that release clause in his contract, that’s why there are a few clubs having a look at him.

"But United need to spend in January to improve the squad, and he’s somebody they wanted to bring in during the summer before he signed that contract. If the opportunity comes up when the window opens, it would make a lot of sense because he would also be able to plug that hole left by Mbeumo."
Brandon Williams' post-Manchester United career could have taken a further blow after Hull City manager Sergej Jakirovic admitted he could leave the club permanently in the January transfer window.

Williams racked up 51 appearances for the United senior team having come through the academy at Carrington. However, his career took a drastic turn two years ago when he was involved in a high speed crash.

In May 2025, the defender was handed a 14-month prison sentence, suspended for two years, a three-year driving ban, and a significant amount of community service at Chester Crown Court. "It was just a learning process. Things did happen, but like I said, I've learned from them now. I'm growing up now, I'm not a young player no more," he said.

"I'm becoming one of the senior players in the squad as well, so it's important for me to help the young players as well because I know how difficult it is. It was difficult because everyone kind of forgot what I actually achieved; people don't understand that.

"I didn't even understand at the time what I've actually achieved (playing for Manchester United at such a young age). There are a lot of people in the world who would wish that for their child or something like that. It was upsetting that I've let a lot of people down; it's for me to get things right now.

"Like, I've always said as well, I don't want any sympathy from anyone. It was my actions; I took responsibility for them. I've apologised, and all I can do now is just focus on my football and get things right on the pitch, and I'm sure that people will appreciate that."
Teenage sensation JJ Gabriel has reportedly attracted the interest of Barcelona.
The Spanish giants are said to be working hard to lure Gabriel away from United and bring him into their renowned La Masia academy.

"Like everyone, I know he is a really talented guy and everyone paid attention on social media," Ruben Amorim said. "You could see the U21s had a game and we had less players and tried to pick players for training that have talent.

“Not just for me to see for tomorrow but for them to feel what it means to be in the first team, the difficulties playing against our defenders, the difficulty of our training, the pace. If we can use every training we have to show the kids what they need to do to be here, it is important, not just for JJ but for everyone."
He has scored ten goals in ten games for the Under-18s this season.
According to TEAMTalk, Manchester United's interest in Antoine Semenyo is 'growing', with the Reds starting to believe that paying a premium is going to be worthwhile for the Bournemouth winger.

United view him as a versatile, proven-quality addition for the future, especially if they return to European competition. However, the Reds are preparing for a January bid as they are concerned that waiting until the summer could result in them failing to sign him.
Man United have received a huge boost in their pursuit for Conor Gallagher, it has been claimed.
In his YouTube channel, Fabrizio Romano reported there was a chance Gallagher could depart the Estadio Metropolitano this January.

"I think there is a chance for Conor Gallagher to leave Atletico Madrid already in the January transfer window or eventually in the summer," Romano said. "This will also depend on the formula of the deal. Manchester United were interested in Conor Gallagher as an opportunity in the final days of August but Atletico said no to a loan move and they don’t have that kind of intention.

"I think if maybe a permanent transfer proposal arrives, that would be different. Maybe something around 30 million euros (£26m), sources say that this could be the way to get Conor Gallagher in the January transfer window."
Manchester United are prepared to compete with Arsenal for the potential transfer of Eintracht Frankfurt's Nathaniel Brown.
According to BILD, there is a significant risk of Frankfurt losing Brown this summer, and the Premier League could be his next destination.
It's suggested that Frankfurt are in a position where they will have to sell the two-time Germany international.

Spanish outlet Fichajes claim Man United have submitted a £53million bid to sign Newcastle United star Harvey Barnes in January. The winger has scored four goals in his last six Premier League appearances.

However, it's said that Chelsea have also made a 'similar' proposal for the 27-year-old. With that said, Newcastle have no plans to part ways with Barnes at present, viewing him as difficult to replace.
Man United are monitoring Atalanta youngster Sergej Levak, according to Calcio Mercato.
The 19-year-old has been likened to Rodri, with a knack for arriving in the box at just the right moment, and is expected to make his first-team debut in the near future.
It's said that United have had a scout tracking his recent games, though a 'number of big clubs' are also watching him.
According to LaRoma24, Roma's management has received approval for the needed budget to secure a high-level striker, and Joshua Zirkzee is mentioned as one the Italian club want.
It's said that Roma's ownership will guarantee financial coverage for the deal, whether it is a loan or a permanent transfer. Zirkzee, however, could still stay at United in January.
Antoine Semenyo REJECTED an offer from Manchester United in the summer, it has been reported. The Reds wanted to sign the Bournemouth winger but he turned down the chance to move to Old Trafford.
He instead remain at the Vitality Stadium, though United still remain interest and are tempted to re-ignite a potential move for Semenyo during the January transfer window.
Jean-Philippe Mateta is said to be of interest to Manchester United again, according to journalist Alan Nixon, with the Crystal Palace forward refusing to sign a new contract at Selhurst Park.
United were previously quoted a price of £40million when they enquired about a transfer for the 28-year-old, who has 18 months left to run on his contract at the Eagles.
It's said there is a good chance United sign Mateta with Palace eyeing up Manchester City's Divin Mubama, who is on loan at Stoke City, as a replacement for the France international.

According to a latest report from Tuttomercato in Italy, Napoli's 'most likely option' is to sign Kobbie Mainoo from Manchester United. Antonio Conte's side want to negotiate a loan with an option to buy the England international, who has struggled for game time at Old Trafford this season.
Mainoo has indicated he is available, though the situation is expected to be become clearer in two weeks ahead of the January transfer window opening.
According to The Athletic, Manchester United 'agreed personal terms' with Carlos Baleba in the summer, though the Reds did eventually opt against making a bid for the Brighton midfielder.
As was the case then, this is not a deal that will come cheap for the 13-time Premier League champions, should United attempt to come back in for him during the January transfer window.
Indeed, Brighton wanted at least £100million for the Cameroon international, who is also attracting interest from Tottenham, and the Seagulls are expected to demand the same amount now.

headline: MARSHALL: What Ruben Amorim told Leny Yoro after Manchester United reaction
body: Ruben Amorim has told Leny Yoro to stop beating himself up over mistakes, and revealed he had pulled the young centre-back aside after he showed his frustration in Manchester United's win at Crystal Palace on Sunday. Yoro conceded the penalty which allowed Jean-Philippe Mateta to open the scoring at Selhurst Park, before goals from Joshua Zirkzee and Mason Mount saw United side roar back in the second half.

Amorim took Yoro off during the celebrations for the equaliser, with Noussair Mazraoui already stripped and ready to come on. The 20-year-old showed his frustration as he was withdrawn and needed an arm around the shoulder from Mason Mount at full-time. That gesture was praised by Amorim, who revealed he had spoken to Yoro about his reaction to mistakes and also used this week to show him clips of positive elements from his performance at Selhurst Park to try and rebuild his confidence.

"I also spoke with him because he thinks too much, he makes a mistake in the game and then he struggles because he’s too young and he wants to do everything so well," the United head coach said. "He’s growing, with games and with setbacks, it’s not easy for him as a young guy. He cannot give that to the people the way he came to the bench, he understands that but he was really frustrated.
"On the good side, it shows that he cares, he knows it wasn’t his best game but he did some things well and I showed him that also. He’s fit and ready for the next challenge."

Amorim also insisted there was room for improvement in the performances of Diogo Dalot, while praising his ability to play as a wing-back on either flank. "He can do a lot of things better, like other players," he said. "When you see a very good game of Diogo he can show he has the quality, but sometimes he drops a little bit.

"He’s really powerful, he’s good on set-pieces, he can play both sides. To have that ability of playing both sides that can help you to think about the squad. He’s a very important player for us but he needs to improve like another player."

headline: MARSHALL: Amorim drops Shea Lacey Manchester United debut hint
body: Ruben Amorim believes Manchester United teenager Shea Lacey is ready to make his senior debut for the club, despite leaving him as an unused substitute against Everton and Crystal Palace. The 18-year-old has had his first taste of being part of a matchday squad in recent weeks and the forward is highly-rated within the United academy.

Although he didn't get on for his senior debut and could find his place in the 20-man squad taken with Matheus Cunha's return to action, Amorim insists Lacey is ready for a chance and will get one soon. United have no European games this season and are already out of the Carabao Cup, reducing the number of opportunities for young players to feature.

Lacey has been training with the senior squad and Amorim has been focusing on the differences between playing for academy sides and the speed of first-team football. Even if he is out of the squad against West Ham on Thursday, Amorim insists it is a matter of time until he makes his debut.

"Try to explain every day how to play, because if you're comfortable and don’t have many doubts when you are playing that will help the kids to play," Amorim said of his approach to Lacey in recent weeks.

"Then to work the physicality, to understand when he’s training with us, understand the speed of the pressure, the moments to have the ball and pass the ball is completely different to Under-21s. That is the only way I know how to prepare a kid to play for the club, especially this club. He’ll have the chance, I don’t know when, but he’s ready to play."

headline: 'Not enough' Former Man United star handed fresh career blow as January exit looms
body: Brandon Williams' post-Manchester United career could have taken a further blow after Hull City manager Sergej Jakirovic admitted he could leave the club permanently in the January transfer window. Williams racked up 51 appearances for the United senior team having come through the academy at Carrington.

However, his career took a drastic turn two years ago when he was involved in a high speed crash. In May 2025, the defender was handed a 14-month prison sentence, suspended for two years, a three-year driving ban, and a significant amount of community service at Chester Crown Court

Williams would spend time on loan at Ipswich Town in the 2023/24 campaign but after just 17 appearances for the Tractor Boys, the Reds decided to release the defender. After being a free agent for the entirety of the 2024/25 season, Hull decided to take a punt on Williams and offered him a one-year deal.

Following the transfer being completed, Williams insisted he was ready to atone for the errors he made previously. He said: "It was just a learning process. Things did happen, but like I said, I've learned from them now. I'm growing up now, I'm not a young player no more.

"I'm becoming one of the senior players in the squad as well, so it's important for me to help the young players as well because I know how difficult it is. It was difficult because everyone kind of forgot what I actually achieved; people don't understand that.

"I didn't even understand at the time what I've actually achieved (playing for Manchester United at such a young age). There are a lot of people in the world who would wish that for their child or something like that. It was upsetting that I've let a lot of people down; it's for me to get things right now.

"Like, I've always said as well, I don't want any sympathy from anyone. It was my actions; I took responsibility for them. I've apologised, and all I can do now is just focus on my football and get things right on the pitch, and I'm sure that people will appreciate that."

Sadly for Williams, his chance to put things right on the field has not been forthcoming. The 25-year-old has struggled with his fitness and has made just one appearance in the Championship which was a five-minute cameo in the second game against Blackburn Rovers.

Jakirovic confirmed on Wednesday that Williams is now back in the treatment room again and his time at Hull could be coming to an end. He told BBC Humbserside Sport: "He felt yesterday his calf a little bit sore, he will go on an MRI and so we are awaiting news.

"Also we made one plan for him, six weeks plan, so he has the rhythm of the game so he played for the U21s and together with the club now we will decide what we will do with him in January - he will stay with us, he will fight for his place or he will continue forward maybe to change the club. But, we will see, this is also a question for all of the club.

"Right now, in those games (for the U21s), he showed something but I don’t know if this is enough for Championship. This is something that I need to decide for the January window - he will stay or he will change."

When asked if this would be more likely to be permanent rather than a loan, the Hull manager said: "Yes, yes, yes we are speaking now because January, if we can swap some positions we will do that but if we cannot then we will continue like this."
"He’s understanding. I cannot say now that he looks much better than when he arrived here but for the Championship you need an even better level," Jakrovic concluded.

headline: Joao Gomes is about to miss out on perfect Man United transfer opportunity
body: Manchester United are counting down to the next summer transfer window where they will, inevitably, add yet another midfielder to their ranks. Casemiro has held down the fort this season and to varying degrees of success, but his contract expires at the end of the campaign.

Should that happen, United would, of course, need to sign a defensive midfielder to plug their gap in the centre. Currently, there are no players in the squad who you could see being the first choice once Casemiro exits. Manuel Ugarte would be the obvious solution, on paper.

However, the Uruguay midfielder has underwhelmed when he has played for United and his performances in the main have been more misses than hits. Beyond the ex-PSG man, the Reds struggle for options. That's why the auditions have been opened for stars to impress Jason Wilcox and Co. ahead of potentially moving to Old Trafford next season.

Brighton and Hove Albion's Carlos Baleba was first up to the plate, but his display was tough to watch. He made a rod for his own back with a 'joke' message to supporters ahead of the game, which was quickly deleted. When the whistle blew, very few were left laughing.
Baleba struggled to stop Bryan Mbeumo all game and, when he was eventually hauled off, the shake of his head said it all. Last Sunday, it was the turn of Crystal Palace's Adam Wharton to impress.

United know Wharton can perform better than he did at Selhurst Park and mitigating circumstances were at play for his display against the Reds - chiefly among which was him featuring in Strasbourg on Thursday evening. While he would not be a direct replacement for Casemiro, the Englishman is still seen as an option to rebuild the midfield and if he was aiming to put his best foot forward, it did not work out.

He would have been eager to make a good impression, but a booking against Nottingham Forest on Wednesday night was his fifth of the season. This means Gomes will be suspended when United arrive in town and, thus, a big opportunity is missed for the 24-year-old.

Nobody has taken their chance to show the United recruitment team why they should be the club's No.1 option in the summer transfer window. Gomes' moment was right there, but it has gone completely now.

Matheus Cunha has said Gomes reminded him of Casemiro and undergoing a suspension is something the United midfielder knows all-too well. It's by no means a deal-breaker him being unable to play the Reds on Monday night, but it's very easy to put yourself in the shop window when you face United.
But with that chance gone, Gomes must set his sights on the return fixture at the end of this month.
Such a short period before the next meeting vs United is the only saving grace for the Wolves midfielder.
